Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on Perioperative Airway Management

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the expert panel, and a sample size calculation was not applicable.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included expertise in thoracic surgery, otolaryngology, general surgery, cardiac surgery, anesthesiology, and nursing. The study setting involved face-to-face meetings.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention used a modified Delphi method to achieve consensus on airway management recommendations, with a comparator of previous consensus documents.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to update the expert consensus on airway management by incorporating the latest research findings.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was achieving ≥70% agreement on recommendations, measured immediately after discussions.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted with 62 domestic experts from various surgical and anesthetic specialties.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Consensus was achieved with ≥70% agreement among the 62 experts, ensuring robust and widely supported recommendations.
